instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 water damage green/orange no fan.
threads.message:
all main V Rails are o.k

PM_BATLOW_L = 3,3V
PM_PWRBTN_L = 3,42V tigger smc on/off o.k!
PM_RSMRST_L = 0V
PM_DSW_PWRGD = 3,3V
PCH_DSWVRMEN = 2,1V
SMC_ONOFF_L = 3,4V 

PCH_INTRUDER_L = 2,0V
PCH_INTVRMEN = 0V
PCH_SRTCRST_L = 2,2V
RTC_RESET_L = 2,2V 

PPVRTC_G3H 2,2v
PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1 0.1v

threads.title: 820-00165 water damage green/orange no fan.
threads.message:
"PPVRTC_G3H 2,2v"
There must be the problem.
Check for corrosion around U1900; you may need to change the chip.
Inspect all caps from PPVRTC_G3H power rail.

threads.title: 820-00165 water damage green/orange no fan.
threads.message: i was replace U1900 and replaced some suspicion Caps but the same PPVRTC_G3H 2,2V

threads.title: 820-00165 water damage green/orange no fan.
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground at PPVRTC_G3H.
Post all U1900 voltages.

threads.title: 820-00165 water damage green/orange no fan.
threads.message:
So you have now 3.2V at PPVRTC_G3H, no more 2.2V there?
Please, post accurate information.

040 is very low value for PPVRTC_G3H in diode mode to ground.
That means PCH internal problem; if removed all caps from the rail.
You can try to heat with quality flux; may be just accumulated crap underneath.

threads.title: 820-00165 water damage green/orange no fan.
threads.message: Did what I suggested in the previous post?
